page.title: 14Housing in NW Derby, part 1
page.content: Many of Derby's main residential areas are found in the peripheral area of the City, some of them originating as agricultural villages. Wherever poss- ible community spirit and sense of identity has been encouraged by succ- essive councils, even though, grad- ually, all areas have become a part of the City. From 1980 the City Council approved a new policy for the future of older houses, one of renewal and improvement rather than clearance. They created Housing Action Areas and General Improvement Areas where owners are encouraged to improve their prop- erty, with the aid of grants of beween 60% & 90% towards approved costs. In the 1980's the City Council is turning its attention to inner city areas, now that building developments on the outskirts are nearing completion.
